newsitem.title: USA: GE Capital provides Ward $1 bln facility.
newsitem.headline: GE Capital provides Ward $1 bln facility.

text.p: GE Capital Services said Monday it had a $1 billion debtor-in-possession facility for Montgomery Ward.
The department store chain filed for bankruptcy protection earlier Monday after talks with lenders for new funding to pay $1.4 billion in debt failed.
GE Capital said the $1 billion facility would help assure that the Chicago-based retailer's stores stay fully stocked for the holiday selling season.
"We are convinced that Montgomery Ward's filing under Chapter 11 of the bankruptcy code is the best way for the company to conclude a quick and effective restructuring," GE said in a statement.

GE Capital Services, a division of General Electric Co, said it wrote off in the second quarter its investment in the common stock of Montgomery Ward, which it acquired in a $3.8 billion leveraged buyout in 1988.
Despite the write off, GE Capital said it "expects to announce strong double digit earnings growth for the quarter."
